newsitem.title: INDIA: One mln Indian telecoms workers to go on strike.
newsitem.headline: One mln Indian telecoms workers to go on strike.

text.p: About one million workers of India's state-owned telecommunication and postal departments are expected to go on an indefinite strike from Wednesday over a wage dispute, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said.
PTI quoted trade union officials as saying they would go ahead with the nationwide strike after talks with Communications Minister Beni Prasad Verma over alleged bonus disparities failed.

There was no official comment on the proposed strike.
PTI said the Department of Telecommunications had asked senior managers to help stop any disruption in communication links after talks between union leaders and Verma broke down.
PTI quoted Verma, a socialist politician in Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda's cabinet, as pleading with the unions against the strike with an offer of a "justifiable" solution.
PTI said the government cancelled all leave of officials in the control rooms of its nationwide telephone network.
